{"step_by_step_thinking": "Mossy fibers are axons of granule cells in the cerebellum and hippocampus. They are known to release glutamate, which is an excitatory neurotransmitter. GABA, on the other hand, is an inhibitory neurotransmitter. There is no evidence to suggest that mossy fibers release GABA.", "answer_choice": "B. no"}
